content:
(I'm not sure if this is a cargo question or a crates.io question)

I found a crate on crates.io that has an unparsable Cargo.toml manifest: https://crates.io/crates/svd_macros/1.0.0

This surprises me a little bit, since I assumed that either cargo or crates.io itself would ensure the manifest is well-formed. Am I wrong in that assumption?
(I found this crate while doing some experiments that involve downloading crates and analyzing them. I don't need to use this crate and can easily ignore it, but I'm still curious about it)

It's hard to say what happened 7 years ago. crates.io doesn't do any validation.

Looking at the Cargo.toml, I vaguely recall that the toml crate might have allowed that in the past (the tokenizer wasn't very particular about newlines).
Yea, Rust 1.11 allowed that Cargo.toml. It was fixed in 1.12
